description:
Well it's chipotle what do you expect. 
I was pleasantly surprised by the veggie bowl.
The burritos are not very good and really messy.
author: nancy w.

description:
This location is CLOSED. It is now Koja Kitchen.

Just adding some text here so it's long enough for a review. Posting this so others don't waste time trying to find it. I am not sure when it closed.
author: Eric v.

description:
Great Chipotle in the Westfield San Francisco Centre mall. I was staying at the Axiom Hotel across the street (it's literally only like a two minute walk) and needed a quick, easy dinner before I turned in. 

The staff was friendly and I came about 40 minutes before closing time, so they weren't too packed at all! I was in and out with my to-go bowl.

I got my usual: a chicken bowl with pinto beans, brown rice, mild & medium hot sauce, cheese, sour cream, and GUAC (get outta my face literally if you don't worship guac).

Got back to my hotel and ate it all up. Definitely recommend if you're staying at a nearby hotel or if you're in the mall!
author: Lauren P.

description: One of the best restaurants in the entire USA in my opinion. The flavor is just unbeatable. Their chicken marinade is amazing and I cannot get over their guacamole. Always fresh and tasty. The service is quick which makes it perfect for pick up lunches. Their restaurants are usually clean and presentable. I highly recommend having their burrito bowl.
author: Julia J.

description: Good option at the Westfield mall. The main food court looks good but the food is not that great and this serves as a good alternative. Can't go wrong with the chicken bowl with guac.
author: Sunil R.

description: The food here is kind old. I've eaten at chipotle for 15years. The rice and beans will be super old. The grill here looks dirty. I worked in food and this place needs to be cleaned. The food is never hot when being served here. Even the glass to where you are served was dirty. I do pay attention to details and I was very concerned about this location.
author: Sean V.

description: This place kinda sucks, but I'll be darned if I just can't get enough Chipotle. I go here, I order the food, I eat the food. Sometimes I get some pop, and I drink the pop. It is good, and it all goes down easily enough.  Certainly comes OUT much easier than it goes in, and I've had to buy many new pairs of panties after a dreaded Chipotle visit, but what are you gonna do! Just gotta watch out for the homeless people around here. They are aggressive as hell, and they have no shame at all. Boi, do they want those drugs! But don't give them money. They are all liars and just want to steal your children and stuff.
author: Michael S.

description:
1st and last time eating Chipotle today. Wondered what it was all about, so I finally caved. Wouldn't eat this again for free. Rice was undercooked-three or four bites of hard rice which I initially thought were bone fragments from the meat. Other than that, just a very substandard burrito. 
Also-RIDICULOUS that they charge an extra $2.45 for guacamole. I pointed to the area with all the fresh/green ingredients (salsa, lettuce, etc) and confirmed I wanted everything but corn. Guacamole was in there too. They put it on and I made it very clear that I had no interest in paying an additional two and a half dollars. She didn't charge me for it.
author: Richard V.

description: The barbacoa bowl I order had a piece of plastic inside. It seems like it was part of a straw. I was lucky I was not wolfing down my food as I almost didn't catch it. When I reported to the employee, they didn't really seem to care at all. Terrible service. The workers did not care what they did and never enunciated their voices. It was almost impossible to hear what they were asking.
author: Wallace L.

description: Pretty good food, but can somebody teach them how to properly wrap burritos and portion their servings better lol
author: Clinton D.

description: Zero star if i could! This is by far the worst one I've ever visited! Any other locations I've been to give out food much more than this location does! I've been here twice and both times fed with displeasures. This time the woman at the counter just scooped one scoop of rice and then dumped half out!! I asked for a bit more just to meet the standard quantity and I even said I could pay if there was an extra charge and she was very reluctant and unhappy to scoop another little half. Just like the first time a man treated me with scoop-and-dump, probably that's their employees specially trained skill to save food for the company. Anyway I'd never go to this chipotle again!! I may also blacklist this company that takes advantage of customers! so damn disgusting
author: Svetlana L.

description: Worst customer service I've ever received. For a location that a lot of tourists would be going to, they need to step their game up! They skimp you on the portions and they rush you! I get that it's busy but if you guys dnt know how to handle the pressure in a professional, courteous manner then you need to transfer to a slower location!
author: Jhuanna M.

description:
My cashier, Issac was so rude. When I went to the line, he was talking to a friend. I waited patiently. When he was finally done, he totally ignored me and took another guy's order. Issac assumed we were together. When he finally realized we weren't, he brushed it off. He never apologized or anything. He began taking my order, but did not cancel the other guy's order. When I brought it up, he gave me an attitude. It's not my fault that you can't have your stuff together. 

The total was different from what was listed. So I brought it up, and he made a rude gesture as if I am wrong. However, the total differed because of taxes. He did not explain that to me. I had a horrible experience, and even the other customer who got his order first felt the tension between the cashier and I. I am honestly turned off from Chipotle. I went to enjoy my meal, not be treated like a second class citizen. I am not shocked about the reponses from the other customers.
Rude customer service. Dang for a $9 lunch, I will pass. NEVER AGAIN.
author: James H.

description: I have heard a lot about Chipotle Mexcian Grill, but never got the chance to eat their food until today. Surprisingly, food was amazing. I got the steak bowl. It comes with rice (white or brown), beans (pinto or black), veggies, corn salsa and lettuce. Additional charge for guacamole. Restaurant was clean. Staff was friendly. What a great first experience!
author: A B.

description: Great but the amount of queso is not accurately advertised on the website. It is a tiny amount in a plastic container.
author: Tara K.

description: I always go to chipotle and I love it, but today I went, a worker named Trayona finessed me and my friends. She told us to go give feedback (all 5 stars) on the store to get a bogo coupon but they lied and the coupon has EXPIRED. THE RAMEN PLACE AJISEN ALSO FINESSED US ON THE SAME DAY AND MADE US PAY $15 TIP ...
author: Allison L.

description:
Enough with the browsing and shopping, my sister and I are hungry. It is already hitting close to 2:00 PM, which is a little past lunch. Ooh, the lines are long at some of the eateries in the food court. 

The only place where the line is moving slightly faster than a snail's pace is Chipotle. It is also packed with wall to wall people with families. My sister and I almost could not find any available seats for a sit down fast lunch.

There is only one item that I usually order from Chipotle, and it's the grilled chicken bowl with brown rice, pinto beans, pico de gallo, sour cream, cheese, guacamole and shredded romaine lettuce. Nothing else appeals to me. To think I used to like the grilled chicken bowl a whole lot. My taste bud must have changed over the year. It's okay and it's edible, but it just does not have the same freshness of the chipotle grilled chicken bowl that I truly enjoyed from an eatery business on West A Street in Hayward. I have become spoiled to that chicken bowl. Besides this Chipotle was a little skimpy on the brown rice compared to the Chipotle in the Alameda Southshore Center.
author: Carol C.

description: Last week was the second time I've gotten sick from this specific Chipotle. I've never been sick from another one. I would avoid going to this location because the obviously don't handle the food correctly.
author: Kayla F.

description:
Those who know me know that I can never get enough Chipotle. because of that, I've been to almost every location between my hometown of Sacramento and the Bay Area. This, my friends, is one of the worst. 

Chipotle's are already eternally crowded, so putting one in the food court in a mall was an obvious bad decision. Lines from neighboring eateries bleed over, people cut through in front of you and the food is rushed out at a much faster pace. The gal who was scooping my carnitas lazily let the meat and juices drip across the chicken and steak as she brought it to my tortilla. Whatever for me, shitty for the person who doesn't want their chicken to taste like carnitas. The attitudes of the employees here are sub par compared with other locations. 

After reading some other reviews, I must say it's not fair to judge a Chipotle based on comparisons to the countless more awesome authentic Mexican joints in SF. We know SF has countless awesome Mexican joints. I go to Chipotle because it's predictable, quality fast food.
author: Alex L.

description: Too slow service and all they care about is making money horrible service to their customers and also it is very disgusting. They never clean the floors or the tables. Never going to spent a cent here
author: David G.

description:
Weakest chipotle I ever been to. They always skimp you w/ the portions & the workers are lackadaisical. Sanitation always looks like an issue as well. Their containers always have excess food & always look like they need to be wiped down. 

Advise you to go to the one up the street.
author: J D.

description:
Chipotle. Bless me with thy holy meat.
I've been coming here since I started doing night classes at SFSU extended learning on the 6th floor. I come here after work, eat, and then soak in knowledge.

This is my order every time. I believe I get the most bang for my bucks. I get a Bowl, ask for mixed rice, mix beans, the bell peppers, chicken, all the sauce, cheese, sour cream, and corn. No Guac, too expensive cause I gots no Guap. Amazing, I know. Don't forget to get chipotle's smoked tobacco sauce and rain it on top.

I have been ordering a bit different. Bowl: mixed rice, no beans, bell peppers, chicken, all the sauce, cheese, sour cream, and extra corn. No Guac, please. 

Enjoy,

T
author: Teason M.

description:
I usually don't complain about Chiptole. You know what items they have and the choices I usually pick are limited. I got there around 6:30 pm on Monday, the selection of the items they had available was almost nil! They had hardly any brown rice, ran out of black beans, didn't serve vinaigrette dressing and almost ran out of guacamole!

The salad, chips and guacamole I got were very good and filling but "where's the food?!"

I hope management will pay attention in the future and make sure the food options are available to the consumer.
author: Genevieve K.

description: What happened Chipotle? Your food used to be wonderful and reasonable. This location has turned me off of eating your product for good. 18 dollars for two grease filled quesadillas with a serving of steak that you need to actively look for. If you are at this location I would recommend venturing to many of the other authentic and cheap Mexican restaurants in the area.
author: Asa H.

description: Bad customer service. They put an ingredient that I didn't want on the burrito. When I mentioned that I did not want that item she got frustrated and blamed me for the mistake. I was discouraged by the reaction so I left without the food and went elsewhere
author: Brian T.

description: The music is quite loud but the staff are extremely friendly. I was complimented on my makeup which is very kind and outgoing for the employees. It is very diverse as I expected but I was surprised at how seasoned and flavorful the meat was. I enjoyed my chicken bowl very much and other chipotle locations should learn from them.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Expensive n very small portion!! Ordered a burrito bowl and the bowl was not even half full!! Food portion really needs to be worth $10 before I would consider going back.
author: F. C.

description:
I love chipotle. The chain generally has pretty good consistency and quality control, so this is definitely the worst chipotle I've been to. Asked for double meat and they gave me two dainty half scoops of meat. When i complained, they just stared. Got charged for double anyways.

They had no peppers and just onions, which were also burnt and inedible. This place needs new management
author: Steven Y.

description:
Chipotle has literally become Taco Bell. Actually, Chipotle has literally become Wienerschnitzel, that's how bad the Mexican food here is. 

I'm such a huge fan....or I used to be. My love for Chipotle was barely hanging on like a pinto bean blowing in the wind. This location blew that pinto bean straight into the ocean. 

It's only 8pm and this Chipotle is already out of EVERYTHING that makes Chipotle delicious. 
They didn't have sour cream, they didn't have guac, they didn't have lettuce, they didn't have mild sauce. They shouldn't have employees working here because they're basically nonexistent anyway. My meal should have been free. I'm never going to Chipotle again.
author: John C.

description: This place is horrible. Overpriced and tasteless. The employees are awful at their jobs. They cannot build burritos with the ingredients spread out, so everything they made has the guacamole lumped at the bottom, for example. Pathetic. DO NOT EAT HERE.
author: June L.

description:
Burritos and tacos are one of my favorite quick fix. I have been visiting local taquerias all along for this. Chipotle is now one of my favorite go-to's for burritos and tacos. I have been ordering the burrito, but today I decided to try a new item. This is the burrito bowl, it is delicious and I am craving for another one while writing this review.

- Clean facility (+1)
- Delicious food (+1)
- Good service (+1)
- Friendly staff members (+1)
-- The speed of service actually seemed pretty fast when I came in earlier today which is a good thing
-- This restaurant is inside a mall, some of the items may be pricey
-- Overall, good experience and I enjoyed my burrito bowl meal so I'll be back

9/9/2015:

This is one of the best spots to get something to eat at Westfield Centre.

I came in right after a workout session at the gym. The restaurant wasn't super busy, service was prompt and the guys taking and processing my order were friendly. I also liked the cleanliness of this restaurant facility.

Chipotle makes delicious tacos which I enjoy a lot.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Okay this place is great and all but I'll be talking about the customer service. It's HORRIBLE. I was at the cash register with my friend (we got separate things and before going we agreed to pay together) but my friend told me she was paying for her own at the last minute which I didn't know. However0 before she told me that I told the cashier that we're paying together and she gave me a horrible attitude saying "are you serious?" And it was my mistake because I didn't notice that my friend paid already but you still shouldn't have that attitude. So then we're eating and out of nowhere we hear someone in the back yelling "WHAT THE FUCK?" Or something similar to that as if that person is getting into a fight with someone else but no, they're just joking around!
I actually looked at the cashier (the closest to the back) to see if she even cared or checked what's going on but she's smiling and thinking it's okay and normal so..

Also people who are off on that day or who aren't supposed to be working there are back there with coworkers fucking around like its their hang out. They're really rambunctious and loud and that needs to be evaluated because it's too much. 

Mind you that there's little kids that eat at chipotle? Very very unprofessional, unthoughtful, and insensitive. VERY immature, like are you kidding me? That place has no authority or manager. I mean it's crazy how no one does anything about it (the coworkers I mean) I really hope these reviews get noticed so they can put some authority and discipline in those people because they seem uneducated, rude and obnoxious. No place should be like that and they need to be out in check. No one wants to eat and hear people laugh and be loud and fuck around, it's a restaurant and it's not pleasant for anyone. 

Please train them more and show them what respect means! This is a warning guys, the food is worth it but the customer service and how people act is horrible and inhuman. Kk baaaiii
author: Stephanie F.

description: Chances are they are out of something: Chicken, carnitas, corn, rice or... Seriously, get your act together, please.
author: Demin G.

description: i went to this chipotle with my boyfriend & don't get me wrong we both love chipotle but they just need to learn how to wrap burritos right. everything falls out & it's messy.they should practice like wrapping a baby in a blanket. that's my only complaint i have, other than that the service is great.
author: Miriam P.

description:
You have put these employees on CHECK very 
Distractive works, I order a salad and one of the guys gave a tiny portion of rice and the register girl gave me the wrong change. The manager needs to put his employees ON CHECK. And re-evaluate staff .
author: Beto P.

description:
This Chipotle pretty cool. 
Placed an order online and my order was a little late but they gave me a free fountain drink while I waited. Really nice of them. I'm coming to this Chipotle from now on during lunch time
author: ipod t.

description:
Two Words.

Food Poising

First food intake of the day (on 4/26) at 12pm was a chicken burrito bowl, 3 hours later was the worst 48 hours of my life. It put me out for almost 2 days. Could barely keep water down. Horrible experience. The sad part is I love this place, but now I can barely walk by it without shuddering.
author: Dexter H.

description:
The food was Chipotle-standard. Nothing better, nothing worse. I came here because Joel Osteen was at AT&T Park that night, blocking my access to my beloved Senor Sisig truck, and there's nothing that kills my appetite worse than wealthy, religious white people.

Line longer than I'm used to, didn't move particularly fast, and the dining area needed WAY more attention than it was getting. I had to de-rice my own table with dry paper towels, it was terrible... but it hit the spot... and gave me deadly fajita burps all night that made me want to wander into the Joel Osteen crowd and let loose.
author: Sean B.

description: This is the worst Chipotle location I've ever been to. I went there on my lunch break to get a bowl, and they gave me about half a bowl. Literally half of my burrito bowl is empty and I was charged full price for it. This location needs to get on the same page as other chipotle locations and increase the amount of food they give to customers. Paying over $8 for half of a burrito bowl is absolutely absurd.
author: Zach H.

description:
This was my very first experience at a Chipotle Grill. Where I come from there are none. Zero, Zip, Nada...I liked it because I had a great big burrito just the way I liked it.

I checked out the entire basement food court area at this huge Westfield Mall before deciding to try Chipotle's. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZPC0RMUPgykTI0MBc7V9vg?select=QTadUv236y1WOVJYCeNIbw#WTxEyW_wwTOx_H-7y4vTnQ)

Food: Very limited menu of "kinda of sort of Mexican Food". Burritos, Burrito Bowl, Tacos (Crispy or Soft), Salad, and a Kids Menu...and that is about it. I ordered a Vegetarian Burrito (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZPC0RMUPgykTI0MBc7V9vg?select=QTadUv236y1WOVJYCeNIbw#v24gtRBSHU3mLFtYpOUaQw). Not the California Super Burrito that appears in my dreams, but a solid great tasting burrito. My daughter got the Grilled Chicken Burrito Bowl (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZPC0RMUPgykTI0MBc7V9vg?select=QTadUv236y1WOVJYCeNIbw#QEo-6ujVsWdzic9cqbpx0g). A bit smaller than the burrito it was a nice lighter variation. Of course,  you pick the ingredients with choices for everything like the kind of beans, rice, sour cream and salsa etc. I'm rating these as a 4 star because they were both pretty good.

Service: It was lunch time but not too busy and we were able to find a table and service was friendly and helpful. Could not complain.

Concept: They are not authentic Mexican dishes and they don't try to be what they are not. The other thing is that they aim to serve naturally raised meats. No hormones etc. The whole restaurant seems to be clean while serving fresh natural foods. The website has a nutrition calculator so you can figure out what you are eating. My burrito had 550 calories. Fat, protein etc. was also listed.

What are they waiting for?: 
We need one of these in Hawaii.
author: Vince B.

description:
I work in the area and am here about twice a month for the last two or three years. I am always amazed at how quickly they get those lines to move and how friendly everyone is that works there. Those kids hustle! 

I burned out on the burritos and bowls so now I get a quesadilla with black beans and hot sauce and it is delish.
author: Sarah S.

description: Got the carnitas bowl last night, 12/29/16, and now I have food poisoning this morning and can't stay out of the bathroom since 6am. I've had this before twice so I am extremely familiar with the feeling. That bowl was the last thing I had last night besides some Christmas chocolate and since I'm not canine I know it's not that. This sucks. I thought they had dealt with this. Anyone else eat at the Westfield Chipotle last night and dropping lbs today?
author: Jordan R.

description:
I love chipotle, but this location is literally the worst. Always mushy or burnt peppers, and somehow ALWAYS out of guac? Get it together... it's not even 5pm on a Thursday how could you possibly be out of GUAC?!

2 stars just because I am a certified chipotle addict
author: Tyler K.

description: Asked if they were still open, they said yes.  When i ordered they were out of a ton of stuff.  Then, when I asked the lady if I could please have the last bit of the guacamole she had an attitude and proceeded to smear guacamole all over the lid of the container as she closed it.  The poor cashier felt bad and tried to clean it up for me.  Then, 5 minutes into eating outside of the chipotle a chipotle worker comes up and asks "can you please finish eating that in the next 5 minutes" as there were tons of people still eating around us. Apparently they were closing soon... they still had the whole inside part to clean so I felt like it was unnecessary to ask me to hurry up my dinner.  Was a really weird and awkward experience. It was my first time eating at chipotle and I'm pretty sure it will be my last.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
No idea why this one is only 2.5 stars. My friend and I came here pre-shopping excursion at Westfield and were served piles of Chipotle's finest eats in burrito bowl form.

Props to the dude doling out rice, beans, and meat - you're the real MVP! He gave my friend and I above-par portions of the aforementioned and the ladies ladling salsa and accouterments also did not disappoint. All employees were nice considering the amount of customers on the weekend.

My chicken burrito bowl (+brown rice, black beans, lettuce, cheese and corn salsa) was phenomenal and what I expect from Chipotle. My friend loved her burrito bowl too, so no complaints all around.
author: Liz G.

description: The service was ok, not very patient they expected you to know the drill. They overcharged me for guacamole 2x which came out to $4.50. Unfortunately I didn't check my receipt before I finished eating. Overall, the food wasn't bad.
author: Suzy R.

description: Wait time 5-7 mins once in the line.  Food is pre prepared so it's pretty fast once you get to the front of the line.
author: Tha C.

description: I work in an office in the Westfield Centre, so visiting this Chipotle is extremely convenient. I go here about once a week for lunch. I've worked in the building for almost two years and Chipotle is the most consistent and wallet friendly "fast" food in the Union Square area. The service is friendly and efficient, the food is consistent, and the lines here are never too crazy. Plus, they just introduced an awesome rewards program. I've been eating Chipotle since college, so it'll always hold a special place in my heart.
author: William P.

description: There's many better options for fast food at the Westfield shopping center downtown than Chipotle. I got my chicken burrito with white rice, no beans, pico, lettuce, cheese, spicy salsa, and it was fine...but I wouldn't come to this shopping center for Chipotle.
author: Denise C.

description: Omg i was eating here today and the food was nasty it needs more seasoning. On top of that there was a scene. The Manager i believe has no manners making scene fighting with a homeless person for some reason. She acted really ghetto.
author: Lara J.

description:
This is NOT a review about the food, but rather of the service that we received when getting food.

The Boyfriend  & I both had really long days @ work so we just wanted to pick up a quick dinner before heading home. We went through the line & everything was great. When we got to the end, the cashier asked him, "is this it?" The Boyfriend pointed towards me & said, "no, she's with me." Mind you, he said I was with him, not my food, but me. Anyway...we paid and took our food home. When we took out our respective meals, I saw the writings "his" and "hers" on the lid rather than the usual abbreviated description of the food that's inside.

I know it's not a big deal...or even a little one; but I just want to give a shout out to this particular cashier (sorry I didn't get her name) for her nice gesture and for her attention to the little things.
author: Karen S.

description:
The assembly line tonight:
1.Confused asian girl who seems like she doesn't know what she's doing
2.Sweaty Caucasian male who rushed me thru my order 
3. Rude cashier

Mild salsa has very mushy tomatoes. Not typical of chipotle.

They ran out of steak.

Worst chipotle experience ever. Never coming back. Upper management needs to make some changes to this location.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It's true. Rather then leaving a long review and repeating what others have already shared, I'll keep it short- THIS PLACE SUCKS! 

EXTREMELY RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL staff. This is definitely the fault of the company, yup the guys sitting at the top, as you can see they're only interested in lining their pockets and properly training staff, and teaching them what customer service means is the furthest thing from their minds. Don't believe me? Type in "Chipotle" in "SF" in (yelp's search boxes above) and look at all the low ratings. 

That speaks volumes. 

P.S. The food isn't fresh.
author: AM M.

description:
This is the worst Chipotle so far in all of Sf. I work nearby and avoid coming here whenever possible and would rather walk further down to the Chipotle by target/metreon. 
First, food is the same, Chipotle standard. However, the wrapping skills are the worst here from the burrito wrapping to the foil wrapping. Your burrito  has a higher chance of exploding here than elsewhere. This has happened to 3 of my coworkers who came to this location myself included, which ended up leaking through the bag (did not even get to the burrito it already unraveled, and it's never that stuffed). 
Second, service absolutely sucks. No one greets you, 80% of the front staff look like they're about to have a throw down. One guy refused to help my coworker get another burrito after writing too hard on the foil it ripped through and ink got on the tortilla. He refused because it was "really busy". They don't know their prices (or they're trying to charge more intentionally) because I order the same things and get different prices. Order a small drink charged for a large. Hmm. 
Third, I have had hair twice fall in my food from here which marks it the last time of me coming to this location. 

This place really gives Chipotle a bad name. I'd get rid of almost all of the front workers if I could. It's filled with young staff, on the edge of ghetto. 

The manager of this location clearly does not give a crap. Maybe this manager should leave as well? 


Bye!
author: Jae T.

description:
Visting San Francisco, and the rental car agent at the airport mentions his mouth waters just talking about this establishment, so we decided to try it...Found it downstairs in Westfield Mall. 

Line went fast for a Thursday lunch...I chose the carnitas burrito bowl, and for the price to pay, it was well worth it... got it with the brown rice, tasted good...way way better than Taco Bell will ever serve! 

People from Hawaii, try this establishment (as we don't have any franchise like this on the islands), you won't be sorry. 

I would not mind coming back to this 'fast-food' restaurant, seating was limited, but finally found space in the larger food court eating area nearby.
author: Dennis Y.

description:
Basic chipotle. Good food as always, regular customer service. 

Figured I would leave this review because only negative reviews seems to come about while the basic good reviews are forgotten.
author: Sarah O.

description: They were so rude and stingy with their portions causing my burrito to be bland. Avoid this place.
author: Nicole F.

description:
I love Chipolte but this Chipolte probably has the shittest service out of all the Chipoltes I've ever been. I still come here because I work nearby and it's the closest accessible Chipotle though but you can't hope to ask for same standard of service you get at their other locations...

First of all, they change staff completely every couple of months. Most of the staffs do not look properly trained. I remember two that couldn't roll up a burrito at all. You can tell they totally fringed what they were doing and it would take them literally fivever. One of them was Latino as well...

Second of all, the person at the cash register will always have attitude. They will ask you the standard "drinks and chips" but only at this location will they roll their eyes at you and speak to you like they have a grudge on all the customers.

Lastly, the reason why I feel prompted to write this unfortunate review was that the pony tail chef from today didn't wear gloves when he was preparing and handling the food. I understand if he was cooking and didn't touch the food but he touched the peppers inside the serving box, pour more peppers in the box, then rubbed his hands on his jeans, then resumed cooking. No hand washing in between. That is not okay.
author: Jannet H.

description:
For several years, my girlfriend has teased me for continuing to eat at Chipotle locations when we're fortunate enough to live in an area with so many authentic taquerias.

I recently started working near this location and made the unfortunate decision to go here for lunch way more than one time. I like to think that I have a high tolerance for failure and incompetence, but let's just say that this location has made me reevaluate my entire life.

I'm quitting Chipotle, and this location is the reason behind my decision.

The staff at this location is generally rude and dismissive, getting many easy directions wrong. On multiple occasions, they have invented their own rules (such as an extra charge for each additional scoop of rice you ask for), ruined the fine artisanal craft of burrito rolling without any care, and forgotten to give me the bags of chips that I've paid for. On multiple occasions where I have asked for double meat, this one specific guy will literally walk my order the entire way and enforce the "double meat" charge to the point where he seriously shouts at the cashier to do so. It's as if he has some crusade against customers.

When these issues happen more than a few times in a row, I actually spend a few minutes going through their horribly designed online form to give them feedback. Each and every time I will receive a generic response offering some free coupon and a promise to speak to the location's staff about their behavior.

I have never witnessed any improvement from this location as a result of any feedback that either myself or my coworkers have given to this place. It's such a shame. The food truly is delicious, but this operation makes the entire company look bad and I just can't eat here anymore. 

But that's okay, since Taqueria Can-Cun is just two blocks away. I'll just bring some cash every day, there's ATMs everywhere.
author: Richard K.

description: My coworkers and I come here often for lunch. The team is always quick and efficient. When wrapping up our order the cashiers are always friendly and provide great service. We will be back for more!
author: Erika A.

description: The line is INSANE at lunch because it's a quick place to grab food in fidi. I wouldn't say it's worth the wait, but then again the food is the same here as every other chipotle so that really depends on your overall average of chipotle! There are just so many lunch options on market and in the general area that I don't completely understand why it's always so packed. I'd say that's good and bad news simultaneously
author: Clay P.

description:
Lemme show some love to my favorite fast food in the world..Chipotle.. Seriously.. Chipotle could do no wrong. If I were on death row and they granted me one last meal.. I would pick my usual at Chipotle. If a genie granted me unlimited food to ever have.. it'd be my usual at Chipotle. If I were forced to eat the SAME food every day for the rest of my life... it'd be CHIPOTLE. And you know what? I'm okay with that. In fact I would probably die happy. I am so jealous of those people that win free burritos for a year.. why couldn't that be.. me...?! T___T

Anyway, four stars instead of five stars because yeah for a Chipotle this location is slightly suckier than others. The quality of food is still the same but sometimes they skimp.. even when I smile extra big and pause after they scoop the ingredient and before I say the next one.

I always get the burrito bowl (less calories hehe and more filling hehe). I've tried the chicken, steak, barbacoa, sofritas..all of them except for the carnitas (not a real big fan of pork and I can't make that commitment to try). Steak is honestly the best one. It taste like real steak and not that salty fake tasting ones in the taquerias on Mission, no offense. The fluffy cilanto WHITE rice is so divine..not the brown one (yechhhh) and I've tried both. But kudos to Chipotle for trying to be healthy. I skip the beans (don't like the mushy texture). Then I get the mild salsa, the corn, the cheese (sometimes I don't to watch my calories lol), and the lettuce!

I say "no!" to that $2 guacamole. The guacamole at chipotle is bland..Remember you can get everything on the side...including the tortilla!

I know literally everything there is to know about Chipotle. They should seriously higher me to be an ambassador. I challenge anyone to fight me in a Chipotle quiz off. Yes, I am that confident and in love with Chipotle. Even this location is worth it for lunch, given the low ratings.

Side note: There is another Chipotle at the Metreon which is probably like a 5 minute walk MAX. And that one is cleaner and more seats and overall nicer atmosphere. But its further from my office so I go to this location instead.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I love chipotle but not from this center (inside the westfield mall). I understand they want to quickly service their customers, but at the same time they need to maintain the quantity right. In a hurry, they drop lot of food and what you end up lesser than you would expect.  When you ask for some ( to compensate for the dropped food ex: chicken) they say it is double. It happened to me many times so I have decided to not to go here anymore.
author: Shaik A.

description:
Your typical Chipotle. The food is the same as always however the service is a bit minimal. They're a little on the lesser side when they scoop your steak, rice, salsa, whatever it maybe. 

The service is always on the minimal when I hesitated whether to buy chips or not, she didn't seem to care and just rushed me. 

Would I come back? Yes, if I was in dire need of Mexican food near the mall.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This is the either the worst or second worst Chipotle I've been to. I've liked all others except the one in Paragon Outlet. 

My friend didn't want beans in his burrito. The person ahead had beans in his, but they had trouble wrapping it so the beans fell out on the counter. By the time they wrapped up my friend's wrap they took the beans that had fallen into the counter and placed it in his burrito.

Also, they were pretty cheap on their portions and it was too salty. Other Chipotle locations are much better better.
author: A V.

description: I never write reviews just to complain but this place has become a joke. I work in the area and have attempted to eat at this location.... I know it doesn't sound like such a big deal but they have "ran out" of taco shells the last 4 of 7 times I've been to this location... After being told this two times in a row enough was enough, it's 6:30pm and your constantly out of a main dish on your menu??? Either the manager in incompetent or just doesn't care and chooses to be negligent.... If your CONSTANTLY running out of a product half way through the day, anyone with common sense would order more... Yes only one star over this... You have to practically beg them for a whole scoop of food even though they just raised their prices.... It's almost $15 for a bowl with guacamole these days.... I'll start packing my own lunches from here on out.
author: John M.

description: This is one of the absolute worse chipotles! Once I was told that they wouldn't take a real 20 dollar bill. There's absolutely no employee centered help as they had 6 people on staff & one person making the food & ringing... Get your shit together
author: Khadeejah S.

description:
It's a little relief to know I wasn't the only one who got bad service.

I typically don't rate at chain places but I like their food and this convenient location inside Westfield so I'm hoping the owner/manager would read these reviews. 

With this subway approach, I assumed the goal is to personalize this Chipotle experience how ever way you want. I personally don't like 5 different people handling one simple food item but i get it, its effcient as we all know the line can get long. 

Everyone who works there are young kids and they simply weren't taught anything about customer serivce or manners. The cashier was soooo annoyed when I asked her a question on their menu and her response was "it's the same price!" It is not even what I asked and she gave me this look as if I just wasted her breath in having to answer a question. 

Sadly, I will return as I pick up a lot of my dinner at Westfield but I will greatly appreciate if management can look into this issue.
author: Maggie C.

description: The portions from this location is probably the smallest I have ever received. My first server was an Asian guy and he literally gave me 3 of the smallest scopes or rice.
author: Marc M.

description:
Breakdown:  Mexican food.  Me gusta, pero no me gusta Chipotle.

How much:  It'll vary with what you get, what you put in, and so on.  I got the steak bowl and that cost about $7+.  

What do you want:  You can get a burrito, tacos, chips, salads, or a bowl.  Then, you have your various meats, beans, rice, veggies, and condiments.

The service:  Oh, boy....man.  I haven't experienced bad service since switching my phone carrier.  Do you have your pillow and blanket ready?  Here's a little story about my trip to Chipotle:  So, I'm in line ready to order my steak bowl with corn, lettuce, medium salsa, and guacamole.  The guy asked what I wanted.  I told him a bowl with steak.  He then asked me what beans I wanted.  I told him no beans.  He laughed and asked what beans I wanted again, and I told him the same thing.  He just gave me a look like he just farted and literally just tossed my bowl to the side for the next employee to work on.  The smirk on his face, I'll never forget it.  So ugly, so hideous.  

Anyways, the next employee asked what salsa I wanted.  I told her medium salsa.  She then said, "Oh, you want mild?  Got it."  But before I could stop her from adding further damage to my bowl, she already added it and tossed it to the next person.  Ugh....my corn.....what about my corn?  But it was too late...  

So, I dreaded the last person to work on my bowl.  I told him add guacamole and lettuce to it.  No problem.  He added the guacamole and started wrapping up my meal like it's ready for delivery.  I told him to stop and add lettuce to it.  Sure, here's your 6 strips of lettuce...yummy!  After seeing that I was just defeated.  My meal felt like the E.T. video game for Atari 2600-- incomplete and disappointing.  

Was it good:  Is steak suppose to taste like a rubber band?  ****!!!!

Verdict:  I don't know what the hell happened, but it happened.  One thing for sure that's not happening is me coming back to this place.  This place is SO NOT RAVEN!!!!
author: Bernard R.

description: In a City where killer burritos are readily available 2 BART stops down (Mission) or where there are other more interesting restaurant choices in immediate range, why would anyone "dine" here? In my situation yesterday, I was short on time, crowd-phobic, desired my "nutrition" relatively cheap, and wanted to know exactly what to expect within my burrito bowl. Ask for A-OK and you shall receive.
author: Eric B.

description:
WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. 
First of all, I had told the worker, Brooke, no to the sour cream then she proceeded to put on the sour cream anyways. I told her I didn't want sour cream and then she yelled "You said yes to the sour cream!!" I told her I didn't want any then she had the audacity to aggressively throw my bowl into the trash can and yelled "back of the line!" I received no apology what so ever. It was extremely unprofessional of her to aggressively argue with a customer and forcefully dump my meal into the trash and yell at me to go to the back of the line after SHE messed up my order. The shocking part was that I was told BROOKE was the SERVICE MANAGER!! Service managers are supposed to set examples for the staff and she definitely did not set a good example. I am extremely upset with the customer service here and it definitely shows they do not have qualified people running this place!
author: Chelsi V.

description: I worked at this chipotle for 8 months. The only people who succeed are perfectionists. Managers get mad when they need to do non management duties, then do them to a bad standard. Total hypocrisy. Soooooooo many tiny details to memorize, then when you learn them, they change. Every manager has a different way of running the store. I got payed more than minimum wage, still not worth it.
author: Dominic F.

description:
Good service is hard to come by in a food court I feel like.. yet this Chipotle suprised me. They don't wow me but they don't dissapoint. I get a little more, and compared to the one accross the street (Metreon) this one is SO much better.

The only thing is seating... they lack seating but there is a lot of spots to sit and eat in the area. Would just suck if you like to use the hot sauce since it is not portable.
author: Tim V.

description: So now you tell me they can't grill the quesadilla with the mild salsa inside horrible! I don't understand why they can't simply do what I asked them I go to other locations all the time and there is no issue. The girl that helped me specifically asked what else did I want in it, why ask what else I want int he quesadilla if you can't put the damn tomatoes in it. I'm done with this location slow service and they didn't even complete my order to my standards. Lost a customer! I wish I could give this place one star.
author: Adrian C.

description: Who is the manager at this store? Seriously worst SERIES of Chipotle experiences I've ever had. One time their iced tea machine "doesn't work." Ummmm, boil some water. They are perpetually out of lemons. (I always have to ask.) This time also "out" of Jalapeño Tabasco. The manager(s) here *seriously* neglect the details and need to be replaced.
author: Kale F.

description: Apparently my review didn't sit well with one of the staff member as they sent me a derogatory and insulting comment. This is exactly the type of customer service that I was referring to in my review.
author: Sylvia V.

description: This is a review for this specific chipotle. I come here often since I'm a huge fan of Chipotle and it's convenient for lunch, but the employees here are all very rude. They never recall or understand any promotions that Chipotle has going on nationally.
author: Jared C.

description: Over the weeks since my first and last experience at Chipotle, I've decided it's really only worth one star, if that.
author: Anthony W.

description:
Writing this as I'm sitting here eating with my boyfriend because I'll forget to write about it once we get back to our hotel (lol I really need to go on a social media detox)

Anyways, this is by far the worst customer service I've ever had at a chipotle! Normally I love chipotle -- for one, the food is always good. Two, customer service has always been cheerful and friendly. Until I went to this chipotle location!

The customer service here is awful. The guy putting together our bowl was throwing things and aggressively sliding entres down the chipotle assembly line. Once we got to the register, the girl ringing had the worst attitude. The manner in which she was speaking to us was flat out rude. She was rolling her eyes at her coworkers AND at me. So unnecessary. 

Chipotle food is always a 5/5 but the customer service here is definitely a 0!
author: Josie L.

description:
ONLINE ORDERING: I order from this location online and pick up there, since it's close to work. I order using their iPhone app, it gives me a pick up time (pick up time is usually 20 minutes after placing the order), I go pick it up. I've done this dozens of times.

RESULTS: They manage to have my order ready for me less than half the time I arrive, at which point, they prioritize my order (it cuts to the front of the line) and they make it for me. On good days, they have offered me 2 for 1 coupons for not having my order ready, on other days they have just given my order to me for free, on days like today, they make no apologies and even ask if I'd like my order in a bag for 10 extra cents (it's a burrito bowl, chips, napkins, a fork and lemon wedge -OF COURSE i'd like a bag. Now what's the point of having paid for all of this by app, if I have to carry money on me?!)

FOOD: Until recently it's been standard Chipotle experience, which is to say it's fresh and well made. But lately, I've had too many moments where I'm biting into something and having to pull it out and look at it. Long, black charred looking bits that seem to come either from the black beans or the chicken. Today, I found these and, even worse, a 1 inch by 1 inch avocado peel in my food. After putting that behind me and continuing to eat, I bit down into something that wasn't food... at least it gave that kind of "crunch" that sounds/feels more like sand or glass or something.

I'm done with this location.
author: Kevin E.

description: Been to PLENTY of chipotles, but this is by far the best chipotle ever. A little busy, but had the best burrito in my life while I was in San Francisco for the first time. :)
author: Michaela P.

description:
The worst experience I've ever had at a Chipotle was here. This happened a few months ago.

My friend and I were eating when we heard arguing at the counter. A woman had brought her burrito, politely explained that they put the wrong type of protein in it, and asked them to make her a new one. The employee behind the counter flat out said no and stated that the customer had definitely asked for what she received. The woman replied that would be impossible since she doesn't eat whatever it was that she got (I didn't hear clearly enough to know what it was). The employee then began a shouting match with the customer and said something along the lines of "why didn't you point it out earlier when we were making the burrito" and how "it was the customer's fault for not checking." My friend and I were floored. The employee was being so rude and caused a scene when she could have done something relatively simple to fix the issue. Eventually, the customer's burrito was remade. A few minutes later, the customer went up to the counter again. Words were exchanged and then the customer walked out, throwing away her burrito. I'm not sure what exactly happened but I'm inclined to side with the customer because the employees then proceeded to openly mock her loud enough so the whole place could hear. Who does that?!

After the whole thing blew over, the employees went back to leaning against the wall/gossiping loudly/walking around aimlessly. Such a mess.
author: Yanni L.

description: This is one of the better Chipotles I've been to. The staff is exceedingly friendly. I frequently order online to avoid the line (seriously, why don't more people do this?!), and the woman who rings me up is very quick, polite, and friendly. My order has always been as I've ordered it, and the portion sizes have been average-to-generous depending on the day. No complaints here!
author: Emily A.

description: Your employees are jerks and your yelp page gives the wrong business hours.  This is the second time I've came to you establishment and been turned away while other customers waited in line.  I hate, Hate, HATE this location and will NEVER COME HERE AGAIN!  On top of that, you don't even know how to update your hours on Yelp.
author: R. B.

description:
I had the Chipotle craving one day after work in the mall, so I went down to the ground floor and ordered my usual "Chicken burrito with no beans" like I usually do at the West Lake Chipotle joint. 

Line was too damn long, staff were ignorant. Later I saw one girl scratch her ear and then take someone's order. WASH YOUR FUCKING HANDS!!!

I swear to god, when I took a bite into my burrito, it was SHIT COLD. I felt like I was eating a FUCKN salad wrapped up by a flour tortilla. HELLA DISAPPOINTED. I took it back to the cashier after that one bite. The girl there said too bad because its what I ordered. WHAT. THE. FUCK. 

NOTE TO SELF: FUCK YOU WESTFIELD CHIPOTLE! Just cuz you Mexican doesn't mean you can make a delicious burrito! The taquerias do better than you! 

FOOD: DISGUSTED.

SERVICE: PATHETIC.

OVERALL: NEVER AGAIN. EVER. (at least from this location)
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Yeah, I get it Chipotle, you got some swag from being the only burrito-making restaurant in the concourse level of the mall, but you know what? I'm done with you. 

I'm done with you for two reasons. One, I no longer work at the G-ddam* Westfield Mall (hallelujah) and TWO: 

You have some questionable food practices. 

Like, cool, you make burritos. That doesn't mean that when I order a barbacoa burrito I like to see the juices from the meat drip ALL over the grilled chicken, the carne asada, etc. Next time I want a grilled chicken burrito with pork juices all over it, I'll just say PASS. 

Most of the time, my food was pretty decent, but after that episode, you should re-think the way your food vats are organized and how you handle them. Who wants to watch the same spoon get passed around from one vat to another? What if I was allergic? Cross-contamination. It's all about how to avoid it, a VERY easy thing to do. A no brainer, but then again, I don't think you care enough. 

Anyway, see ya later Chipotle. Your other locations I've visited were relatively better. But you, you'll continue to serve subpar burritos to tourists, cheap locals, and mall workers that don't have a lot of other options. Adios!
author: Ben G.

description: Showed up here at 8:58 for some dinner. Super stoked that their hours are posted to be open until 10 pm. Yeah. They had completely shut down and there wasn't a scrap of food in sight.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I just bought a chicken burrito bowl and i was unsatisfied with it because everything in the bowl was cold. Usually when I go to other Chipotle spots around the bay I don't have a problem with my food, unlike here. They are really stingy with the serving of portions too. Not planning on going back, waste of my money.
author: Delilah M.

description: I am not sure why the price point is $$$$ - it certainly is $ and most affordable.  We grabbed burritos before going to see a movie upstairs.  Nice, clean, lively place.  Decent and great location in the 'old' food court side of the mall.
author: Maile N.

description:
The only other Chipotle I've been to other than this one is the one at Davis where I went to college.  They are so much more generous with the meat and everything else here.  It seriously puts the one in Davis to shame! I love eating here for a lunch break from work when I'm starving and dreading my next shift.  It really fills me up without giving me food coma.  Burrito bowl with everything and lettuce on top is the best for me :)  

Oh, a minor thing I heard is that they don't have chips or tacos anymore because the fryer is a fire hazard? I thought that was funny even though I don't eat the chips anyways but I thought I'd let future customers know!
author: Lisa L.

description:
I hadn't eaten at Chipotle in about 4 years so when they opened a new location in the SF Centre, I thought I'd eventually give them a try. Over the weekend, the boy and I were doing some shopping and decided to have lunch here.

For starters, the line was ridiculously and painfully long. The employees working the food line were taking forever to make burritos and tacos. When I finally got to order, I decided on some steak tacos. BAD DECISION! After just a few bites, I could tell something didn't taste quite right. The steak wasn't completely cooked! I ended up just picking at the tacos and eating everything but the steak. Also, the rice was sticky. Since when is rice, at any Mexican restaurant, sticky? Ugh.

I know all Chipotles aren't this bad but, if you are even thinking of stopping by this location, just keep on walking. And if you MUST stop here then AVOID the steak! Or at least make sure it's completely cooked.

Last time I go anywhere else but the Mission for a burrito. Lesson learned.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I would give this place 1 star just because of its convenience. The customer service here suck as in the worst customer service possible.

the short girl who usually works at night needs some attitude adjustment. She argues with customers and yells at them. I will make sure to get her name and complain to their corporate office. :)
author: Kathy P.

description:
NEVER coming to this chipotle again. 

The service here is one of the worst I've ever had. I get that it's in the mall, but seriously? The server asked if I wanted white or brown rice - I said brown, but he proceeded to say they don't have any brown. Why'd you ask in the first place then? I thought he was kidding and he was like "nah seriously you thought I was playin? We don't have brown rice. Do you want white rice?" So I was like okay... Got the white rice, asked for both chicken and steak. He have me around 5-10 pieces of each. I hardly call that a bowl at all. Later down the line, I heard him asking what the rice situation was... Apparently there was more brown rice in the pot and he was too lazy to get it for me. The checkout lady forgot to give my boyfriend his tortilla which was on the side and after I asked for water cups and never got them, she saw me standing there and was like "uhh need anything else?" in one of the rudest tones I've ever heard. It's not my fault you forgot the water cups. 

It is not only dirty, but terribly slow. There was so much food leftover with less an hour to mall closing. Why do you have to be so stingy?

Was an avid chipotle customer, but this experience will definitely make me crave chipotle less. Good job, Westfield chipotle. Good job.
author: Tiffany T.

description: so much trash on the tables and workers standing around doing nothing .. no one cleared the trash off the tables for 30+ mins .. very messy .. i will not be going back ..
author: Michael P.

description: Excellent as always!!   I cannot say enough about this location. I always get great service, the food is perfectly cooked, the scoops of meat are generous, and the location is always clean.
author: Camdon I.

description:
One of the worst Chipotles I've been to. I went in at 2PM on a regular weekday, and there was one person on the food station, one behind the cash register, and about three others on the floor refilling the napkin holder, taking out the trash, mopping the floor, and all that good stuff. There was ONE person in line in front of me, and I still managed to have to wait more than five minutes to get my order in. Very inefficient, and I was not pleased. 

The girl behind the register wasn't very friendly, but I don't know why since it wasn't like she was dealing with a huge rush of people. It also sucks that the food is pricier because of the mall markup. At least the location is convenient and clean (it's right near the BART entrance where the smaller food court is), and has a contemporary interior design/setup.
author: Katie M.

description:
This place is a joke. Employees are totally lax, the restaurant is trashed, and the food was well below average, even for chipolte.  

I would recommend getting your burrito fix elsewhere if you want anything remotely good. 

I could go on and on, but there is no point. Chipotle just isn't what it once was.
author: Mike G.

description:
I used to be a huge Chipotle-hater.  I always though that it's wasn't genuine Mexican food, you could get much better Mexican food somewhere else, blahblah.  

Well, I still think that. 

So you might be thinking, why does is Chipotle getting four stars?!  I just kind of accepted that Chipotle isn't Mexican food.  And I realized that once I stopped expecting Mexican food, I actually really enjoyed what they had.  I also discovered their burrito bowls, which is all that I order now. 

Tip:  Generally, if you ask them to put more stuff in the burrito bowl, they will.  So ask for more if you want it!

Overall:  not Mexican food, but yummy food!
author: Sarah W.

description:
good burrito, BUT...

Staff is fucking rude, I asked for sour cream on only one side. BUT NO , that bitch decides to spread it all over . LIKE WTF DID I NOT TELL YOU I ONLY WANT IT ON ONE SIDE, NOT ALL OVER. BITCH. 

After I said enough, she asks me if I want lettuce, BITCH NO!

Horrible customer service, they don't really pay attention to you, and they like to roll their eyes at you most of the time.

& if you want guacamole there's an extra $2.00 Charge. [ not worth it ]

5 stars for burrito.
-3 stars for FUCKING RUDE STAFF.
= 2 stars.
author: Anney T.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Chipotle. So of course when I started working nearby the Westfield mall, my first lunch was here. However, I was really disappointed because the portions were tiny and I was still hungry after I finished my burrito bowl. Also, service was slow and unfriendly. I went again the next day and had a similar experience. 

About a month went by, and I decided to give this Chipotle one last shot. To my surprise, everything had turned around. Portions were generous, service was quick, and the employees were friendly. Not sure if the experience varies day to day, but I'm thinking that they noticed they were slipping up and have since corrected their errors.

Had to still knock off a star because there is never anywhere to sit here. Try to go before or after the lunch hour rush, or be prepared to bring your food elsewhere because it's almost impossible to find an open table around noon.
author: Megan P.

description: Fast service! I go here 3 days a week for lunch. Chicken bowls togo please! :)
author: Dom P.

description:
This Chipotle made me believe in Chipotle again. I'll admit it, after a few of my other Chipotle experiences in San Francisco I thought that something about San Francisco made Chipotle suck. This location, however, is pretty good. 

Since my first burrito here, I have not been to any other Chipotles. But since it had been awhile I was impressed by a few things. First, they have brown rice. Brown rice is awesome. It is delicious and has more texture than white rice not to mention the health side of things. They are also not as stingy about making a normal sized chipotle burrito, none of the tiny burrito bullshit from the one on Powell and O'Farrel.

I was also impressed by the number of employees that work well together to keep the line moving. Everyone that I have talked to is nice too. You can't really beat that. 

Since I work upstairs from here, I will be in a lot with burritos in my face.
author: Peter V.

description: Their service is either a hit or miss at this location. Sometimes i go there and the service is decent and other times i go and the service is crap. I went there once and they ran out of multiple items..so i cancelled my bowl. Chipotle always offers fresh, tasty food.. but the service of the company is not always the best..
author: Hannah W.

description:
I've not had Chipotle for ages but seeing it in the mall made me want to have some.
This place is right next to Ajisen, same like my reviews and this Chipotle is ok.

I love Chipotle and the food is usually pretty standard across the board and this one was not discernibly different to me.

It's not gourmet by any stretch but as Chipotle's go, this one is average. It has brown rice but that doesn't work that well in the burrito bowl in my opinion.

There also seemed to be an odd segregation of duties and layout. Usually there are a number of people helping to scoop out stuff depending on what you ordered. Here it seemed like there were only 2 people who were doing that, not sure what the others were doing.

Made the process take much longer than it needs to. As to portion size, I thought they gave a fair amount, probably depends on who is doing the scooping!
author: Nick L.

description: Yummy as always. Burrito bowl with all my regular fixins! The staff isn't too friendly at this one, however. They look annoyed at everyone, probably because the line is pretty long and it's always busy. Their attitudes need to pick up a little, but the food is tasty =)
author: Priya G.

description:
New Chipotle that opened in the basement of the Westfield Mall, below Nordstrom.

Simply put:
* it's Chipotle, it's the same as every other Chipotle really
* decent burritos
* good service
* they have Chipotle tabasco sauce (the main reason I go there)
* gets busy with a big lineup, but moves pretty quick
* not a lot of comfortable seating within the restaurant itself (it's a small food court type front, but larger with seating inside)
* on the other hand, decent seating outside in the "food court" area. still not huge, but decent enough.
author: Cassandra J.

description: This is the worst Chipotle!! tonight they were out of RICE - how can you be out of rice! they also did not have the fajita mix so I waited for them to cook that and it had chucks of raw onion.  When I went to pay they were out of chips.  The people who work there couldn't care less, clearly they need better management at this location.
author: Isabel R.

description: Today I came in excited to eat chipotle because I love chipotle. I ordered a chicken bowl and the rice was so hard and there was even a leaf in my bowl. Good thing I didn't eat it!
author: Daman K.

description: Fast & fills you up. If you dont like the way that your burrito was made, or bowl for that matter or taco or whatev, simply dont pay for it once you roll down to the cashier, & go somewhere else. More often than not it hits the spot but sometimes the service is a bit rude/stingy, & ocassionally product food hasnt been rotated properly. I hate that the Guac/Avocado makes it $2 more expensive but some times you just need some tortilla crisps & guacamolae
author: Julian I.

description: I am in love with chipotle, and I eat chipotle at least once a week, been to every chipotle in San Francisco, and this is so far the worst of them all. I am very disappointed in this chipotle, they don't give you your money's worth of food. Super stingy! I pretty much paid 7 dollars for a meal portion of a 5 year old... The thing I got the most at, is that I had ask for a bit extra on everything... They gave me a baby scoop of rice, meat, and everything! They amount of meat I got was less than 4 oz... I cook for myself all the time, and I know how 4 oz of meat looks like. On top of how stingy and cheap this chipotle is, they have horrible customer service. Even on top of that, the steak I ordered was cold!!! If I can give a negative rating, I would!!
author: Zihao Y.

description: They actually said they didn't have chips. What's a Mexican restaurant without chips?!
author: Len M.

description: This Chipotle location is the worst! The food was cold and bland! The staff was talking amougst themselves instead making sure your order was quick and hot! I will not go there again!
author: Rebecca S.

description: I enjoy Chipotle, but this franchise is a shame.  The staff have no sense of urgency.  The line was huge, and they all slowly did a half-assed job.  The place was really messy (food all over the tables, trash on the floor, and full trash cans everywhere).  The food was poorly prepared and not nearly as tasty as other Chipotle burritos.  I found stems of vegetables, the rice wasn't hot, and the burrito was wrapped up into a messy ball with no attempt to roll it correctly.
author: Todd R.

description: While ingredients lived up to the hype, the preparation of my Burrito left much to be desired (saggy, formless).  By contrast, Chipotle in Berkeley and Hayward excel in quality.  Not all Chipotles are created equal is an understatement in this case.
author: Orlando P.

description: There's probably no point writing a review about the food you get at Chipotle, because it's pretty standard all throughout the country. Your opinions about Chipotle would probably never change...either you like it or you don't. Personally, I've always had an A-OK relationship with Chipotle. But this one at Westfield Mall happens to be one of my more favorite franchises in the city, since the lines are super short (probably because there are so many eating options in the food court) and the service is super fast! And when you're at it, don't forget to get the Sofritas...it's a Tofu based thing that you can add it to your bowl, which is actually deceptively tasty!
author: Srivatsan S.

description:
I had the pleasure of receiving outstanding customer service from a gentleman named JOVAN. After a stressful flight in from LA and a less than pleasant setback on Bart, my husband and I were famished to say the least. I was in a horrible mood and just wanted some food asap. We were staying at the Mosser and came down to the mall food court for convenience. It was a very busy food court and we decide maybe some Ramen would be good because of the cold night. It ended badly when the Ramen place wouldn't seat us for and hour despite the fact that there was only 2 folks ahead of us, that wouldn't have been so bad has it not been for the horrible customer service. We immediately made the decision to go next door to Chipotle. Despite having a very long line it moved very quickly. My husband wanted steak, by the time we arrived to order they were out. The fella that was at the head of the line then told Jovan. Jovan was working the cash register as well as helping out in every area that needed help. He immediately came over and apologized for the inconvenience and went about doing everything in his power to not only give us wonderful customer service but to get the food out to us as soon as possible. His great attitude and attempts to accommodate us really stood out to us. After numerous interactions with different businesses, airports etc shortly before it reminded me that there are still people out there who want to do their job right and provide their customers with the best customer service possible. 
The food was very good. I am pleased with this location and my experience.
Time of Service Dec 06, 2013 Evening
author: Victoria K.

description: Good food, but very rude service. They took ever to get the rice, n as a result they did not ask about the beans for my burrito. They were rushing up my order. The guy added 3/4 th spoon of chicken n when I asked about it, he said extra would b $2 more. At the end when I asked for Pinto beans at the cash register as I forgot in the ruckus, the cash register girl asked sarcastic questions n ended up adding black beans instead of the requested Pinto. I am disappointed by their rude behavior.
author: Hari C.

description:
Definitely the WORST Chipotle I have everrr been to. I LOVE Chipotle, but this place is very disappointing. The line was super long && it was super hot in there. All Chipotles I have been to make sure to fill up your bowl or stuff your burrito. This place was very cheap/stingy with their portions. I asked the girl for tofu && she gave me veggies. I was going to ask for veggies anyway so I let that slide. Either way I didn't see how she could have misheard me. Veggies && tofu do not rhyme. Anyways, she passed the bowl to the next guy && I asked for guacamole...which by the way looked a day old (brownish green..gross)...he gave me cheese. Seriously?! Again!!?! Guacamole...cheese..HOW did you not understand me?! Does anyone speak English or Spanish? I quickly told him to stop, but he had already put cheese all over. I was already upset, but didn't want to be difficult so I said that was fine. What does he do? Put more cheese. RIDICULOUS! The chips..those things were semi stale. Not okay. 

Ah! Also! In line I overheard a customer ask an employe a question about how food was priced. She was not able to answer her question even though the customer tried explaining her question over && over again. Even I could answer her question && I don't even work there. 

This place needs to properly train their employees, enforce kindness, keep their food on check, AND STOP BEING SO STINGY WITH THEIR PORTIONS!
author: Marisol E.

description: I'm not a regular so I'm  not familiar with how Chipotle works.  The first girl to help me was so rude, she chose my rice for me and pointed to the choices for  beans, meat, etc.  If she spoke to me, it was incomprehensable.  After she handled my bowl to the girl who scoops the guacamole she actually stifled a scream.  Really?!  Because I took a second to decide on what beans I wanted. I realize it's pretty simple to order but it's not like I was holding up the line (there was no one behind me) or took a tremendous time to decide.  There are too many great options at the food court - and they are not their food is not that good or that reasonable - $10.77 for a bowl and chips (no drinks) for me to return.
author: Kimie M.

description: I like everything about Chipotle except the fact that the workers can not hear you because there is a dame window in separating us so I have to tippie toe and raie my voice.
author: Victoria T.

description: Boo. My love of Chipotle cannot bear standing in line FOREVER waiting for the slowest employees in the world to make my food.
author: Melody L.

description: I used to like it for what it was but this locale is very chintzy with the ingrediients. I was lucky if I got a teaspoon of chicken, rice and beans. They mound it all up in the middle to  make it look like more than it is.
author: .James A.

description: This place has more seats than any other chipotle I've been to. I usually come here when I am nearby and craving a burrito bowl. When i used to work in Union Square I went to the one on O'Farrell. I like this one better but the one in Union Square is ok just less seats. As far as service it's alright. Never really had anything negative about this place.
author: Nadav M.

description: So I love chipotle, and they should really pull their branding for this location. I went here first last Saturday. It was pretty busy but I was excited to find it. I ordered a steak quesadilla, what a got was a grease soaked pile of wet cheese an tortilla. I chalked it up to them being busy but I returned today and it was empty, I again ordered a steak quesadilla. After about 15 minutes I got a pile of char, I will no be returning to this location ever again.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Dude you guys...I just became a Chipotle addict recently.  For real. Like up until 2 weeks ago I hated Chipotle because the first time I had it, back when there was only one Chipotle in SF, It tasted nasty. I was scarred for life. Then I saw that there was a documentary about Chipotle on Netflix and I was like ooo  I bet they're gonna talk about how gross they really are cuz McDonald's owns them too ..so I watched it. Totes the opposite.  And ever since that day I've been brainwashed to only eat Chipotle forevers O.o 
So now I'm all addicted and I've already been to a few of the locations downtown. And this one...haha...the guy said they ran out of chicken for one of my orders. it wasn't even close to closing time so like..they should be making more right. .. and I just seen hella chicken on the grill behind him. He didn't even offer if I wanted to wait for it. I didn't ask though cuz I wanted to gtfo. Place looks kinda sticky and grody. Totes not up to par as the others.  Get it together. 
Love, 
the new Chipotle crack addict
author: Mila B.

description: This is the worst chipotle I've been to in California. They are extremely stingy with their portions, and if you ask for more they'll say it's $2.00 extra. It's frustrating going from one Chipotle that gives you a mountain of food in a burrito bowl to this one where the food barely reaches the top of the to-go bowl. If I'm paying the same price I want the same portions. Also, their chips are a mix of old and new, one chip would taste fresh while the other is stale. Overall, I'd recommend skipping this location.
author: Kristen K.
